data.name: Blood Transfusion during COVID-19: Donor Guidelines

flowchartData.name: Donor Guidelines
flowchartData.content:
Donor guidelines

The guidelines for donors involve the following:

  1. Donor search
  2. ABO and Rh compatibility
  3. Facility requirements
  4. Eligibility criteria
flowchartData.content_html:
Donor guidelines

The guidelines for donors involve the following:

  1. Donor search
  2. ABO and Rh compatibility
  3. Facility requirements
  4. Eligibility criteria

flowchartData.name: Donor search
flowchartData.content:
Donor search

The blood bank should identify a list of potential donors from the COVID19 patients who’ve recovered. They should seek help from NGOs as well as patient families to identify voluntary donors of CCP. 

Note: The blood bank must be alert and careful to prevent paid/ professional donations.
flowchartData.content_html:
Donor search

The blood bank should identify a list of potential donors from the COVID19 patients whoâ€™ve recovered. They should seek help from NGOs as well as patient families to identify voluntary donors of CCP. 

Note: The blood bank must be alert and careful to prevent paid/ professional donations.

flowchartData.name: ABO and Rh compatibility
flowchartData.content:
ABO and Rh compatibility

Only ABO compatibility is required in plasma donation. Rh can be ignored, provided anti-D antibodies are not present in an Rh-negative donor.
flowchartData.content_html:
ABO and Rh compatibility

Only ABO compatibility is required in plasma donation. Rh can be ignored, provided anti-D antibodies are not present in an Rh-negative donor.

flowchartData.name: Facility requirements
flowchartData.content:
Facility requirements

  1. Written and informed consent should be obtained for the donation of convalescent plasma from the donor (in addition to the regular donor health questionnaire). 
  2. The Blood bank should have a license for plasmapheresis
  3. The Blood bank should have a facility to measure serum protein. 
  4. The Blood bank should have a facility to measure anti-SARS CoV2 IgG antibodies.
flowchartData.content_html:
Facility requirements

  1. Written and informed consent should be obtained for the donation of convalescent plasma from the donor (in addition to the regular donor health questionnaire). 
  2. The Blood bank should have a license for plasmapheresis
  3. The Blood bank should have a facility to measure serum protein. 
  4. The Blood bank should have a facility to measure anti-SARS CoV2 IgG antibodies.

flowchartData.name: Eligibility criteria
flowchartData.content:
Eligibility criteria

  1. Males or nulliparous females (to avoid the risk of TRALI) 
  2. Weight > 50 kg
  3. Age: 18 to 60 years
  4. Symptomatic recovered patients are preferred since they will have anti-SARS CoV2 antibodies. Asymptomatic donors may also be accepted if the antibodies are present.
  5. Prior diagnosis of COVID19 is not mandatory since the antibody testing being performed now is direct evidence of disease. 
  6. Complete resolution of symptoms:
    1. At least 14 days before donation with a negative RT-PCR test.
    2. At least 28 days before/ post-discharge, with no RT-PCR test.
  7. The donor should not donate more than 2 times a month. 

Note: In addition, also follow donor eligibility criteria for whole blood/ apheresis donation in accordance with drugs and cosmetics act.
flowchartData.content_html:
Eligibility criteria

  1. Males or nulliparous females (to avoid the risk of TRALI) 
  2. Weight > 50 kg
  3. Age: 18 to 60 years
  4. Symptomatic recovered patients are preferred since they will have anti-SARS CoV2 antibodies. Asymptomatic donors may also be accepted if the antibodies are present.
  5. Prior diagnosis of COVID19 is not mandatory since the antibody testing being performed now is direct evidence of disease. 
  6. Complete resolution of symptoms:
    1. At least 14 days before donation with a negative RT-PCR test.
    2. At least 28 days before/ post-discharge, with no RT-PCR test.
  7. The donor should not donate more than 2 times a month. 

Note: In addition, also follow donor eligibility criteria for whole blood/ apheresis donation in accordance with drugs and cosmetics act.
